description: COVID testing compulsory for Mumbai, Karnataka flight passengers: Himanta Biswa -  Assam Health Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma informed that the state government has made COVID-19 testing mandatory at the airport for passengers coming from Mumbai and Karnataka. “Even if they have got themselves tested, they will be tested again here,” he added.

title: Second Covid-19 surge in Karnataka could peak in April
description: The second surge in coronavirus cases in Karnataka could peak as early as mid-April if people follow Covid-appropriate behaviour, said scientists from IISc who have been modelling the outbreak since last year.  This factor is meant to match the 21.5% national sero-prevalence as established by the third nationwide sero-survey, which was conducted between December 17, 2020, and January 8, 2021.

title: Covid-19: Karnataka puts 50% ceiling on theatre capacity, film industry cries foul | City - Times of India Videos
description: After the Karnataka govt put in place a 50% ceiling on attendance at theatres, the film industry has made a fervent appeal to the CM to change the guidelines. The film industry in the state was hoping to be back on track after a nearly a year, but the recent order has once again thrown the industry into chaos. The film industry delegation is meeting the CM to put across their point of view.

title: Karnataka Coronavirus news: Karnataka reports 4,225 new Covid-19 cases, 26 deaths taking tally to 9,97,004
description: With Covid-19 cases steadily rising day after day, the Karnataka government on Monday banned all kinds of protests in the state for the next 15 days, with effect from Tuesday. Sleuths from the Special Investigation Team (SIT) probing the alleged sex-for-job scandal on Monday questioned former minister Ramesh Jarkiholi for nearly four hours. With the state facing an imminent second wave of Covid infections, the lack of coordination among ministers and contradictory views from those at the helm is not only not helping the fight against the pandemic but is also creating confusion among those on the ground.
